page.title: 13Buckland Newton in 1925
page.content: Villagers went to Dorchester once a week and had to cycle.Farmers walked cows to market ,calves went by horses and carts.The first car was a Lagonda owned by Mr.Mitchell.The first steam wagon came to Buckland Newton with bricks to build Dr.Kelly's house which is The Rectory.The doctor lived in Cerne Abbas and came in by pony or foot.There were two pubs in the village; "The Royal Oak" and "The New Inn". Entertainment was local dances and the Buckland Newton Band.Most people made up their own entertainment.There was a nurse and a policeman in the village.Most houses relied on stand pumps instead of running water.Toilets weren't the flush type.Tubs were used instead of a bathroom.Food was cooked over a fire. Candles and oil lamps for light.
